resource.chars:
(2)
One week in these regions has of necessity brought 
out the character of each individual man 
and the majority of the men now remaining have 
proved themselves a credit to the service to which they <s>blo<\s> belong
Mr E.H. Shackleton, who returns much to my regret, 
<s>will<\s> should prove of the greatest use in explaining 
the details of our position and our requirements 
for the future, he will also explain the defective 
nature of the stores supplied by Messrs Maconochie Bros 
I do not think the Presidents can take any steps in 
this matter at present but I hope that on the 
return of the Expedition some compensation will be 
required for such a scandalous breach of faith. 
I have <s>not<\s> acquainted the Scientific officers with 
<s>your<\s> the Presidents intentions in regard to collections & notes 
& the disposal of former collections 
We had been in some doubt in this matter, feeling 
that it would be most desirable that each 
officer should be given the opportunity of working 
up his own collections & notes for publication; the 
arrangement therefore made by the Presidents <s>meets<\s> gives 
<s>with<\s> general <s>approval<\s> satisfaction. 
Hoping that it will be appreciated that I have done 
my best to reduce the wages bill of the Expedition I 
have the less reluctance in representing to the presidents 
that in my opinion two of <s>the<\s> its officers are seriously 
underpaid in view of the work they perform
